result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:19 AM Defendant Deena M Hintz in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Deena M Hintz.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Linzmeier - Rcvd complaint. waive reading and time limits for prelim. Asks for return dates. Asks for bond to be heard RE: no contact. Requesting contact for purposes of business. 
State - requests written notice of bond request.  May be able to do a stipulation rather than having a hearing.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deena M Hintz appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Tomtschik - rcvd complaint. waive reading. Asks for bond to be heard.
State - req $2,500 cash bond. No contact with J.V.A. dob: 11/6/69. No use or possession of alcohol. No weapons.
Atty Tomtschik - argues for sign bond. 
Court - orders $750.00. No contact with J.V.A. dob: 11/6/69. No use or possession of alcohol. No weapons.
Atty Tomtschik - DE needs to provide more info before she qualifies for PD representation. Asks for Adj INIT.
State - no objection
Court - DE needs to provide info to PD's office by next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:35 am.
